item.title: Has Shreeji Shipping Global Ltd declared dividend?
item.description: Shreeji Shipping Global Ltd has declared a 10% dividend, with an ex-date of February 27, 2026. However, the dividend yield is 0%, and total returns over longer periods show minimal growth. Time: Feb 25 2026 11:30 PM IST

item.title: When is the next results date for Jagatjit Industries Ltd?
item.description: The next results date for Jagatjit Industries Ltd is 27 February 2026. Time: Feb 25 2026 11:15 PM IST

item.title: What is the bonus history of LKP Finance?
item.description: LKP Finance has announced a 4:1 bonus issue effective March 6, 2026, meaning shareholders will receive four additional shares for every one share held. The record date and ex-date for this bonus are also March 6, 2026. Time: Feb 25 2026 11:00 PM IST

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has concluded with 4,087 companies reporting results, revealing a nuanced picture of corporate performance across market capitalisations. While aggregate profit growth remains modest, sectoral and size-based disparities continue to shape investor sentiment as the market navigates a complex macroeconomic backdrop. Time: Feb 25 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Star Health & Allied Insurance Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Star Health & Allied Insurance Company Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, raising concerns about the stock's medium to long-term momentum and investor sentiment. Time: Feb 25 2026 06:50 PM IST

item.title: Artemis Medicare Services Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend

item.title: Nila Spaces Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Nila Spaces Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Realty sector, has recently formed a Death Cross as its 50-day moving average (DMA) crossed below the 200-DMA, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This technical development, coupled with deteriorating momentum indicators and a downgrade in its Mojo Grade to Sell, raises concerns about the stock’s near to medium-term outlook despite its strong historical performance.
